sentences: Ta jõudis kohale enne kui oli täistund, mis tähendas, et kell oli veel vaid viid.
context: In Estonian, 'viid' means five o'clock or 5:00. It's the numeral 'viis' (five) in the partitive case used to tell time when referring to the hour marker at the 5 o'clock position on a clock face. This is common in Estonian for telling time - you use the numeral in the partitive case instead of saying 'kell viis', which would be more like 'the clock five'.
